field.name: summary
field.value: Register() on a System.ValueType (like an Int32 or an Enum) instance should throw an exception.

field.name: description

comment.author: sebastiang
comment.text: Why does this restriction exist? I may be given an implementation of an interesting interface whose implementation happens to be a value type. I cannot control that, but I will not be able to register it either.

comment.author: Rory.Plaire
comment.text: Probably the best reason this restriction exists is that if a service is a value type, then the container's component burden will be undefined, since value types cannot (normally) be tracked by reference in the CLR.
